text: A carboxylate is the conjugate base of a carboxylic acid, (or ). It is an ion with negative charge. Carboxylate ions are made when a carboxylic acid loses a hydrogen ion. Such acids usually have pKa of less than 5, meaning that many bases, such as sodium hydroxide or sodium bicarbonate can remove the hydrogen ions from them. RCOOH + NaOH â†’ RCOONa + H2O ==Examples== Some examples of carboxylates include; * Formate, * Acetate, * Oxalate, * Citrate, Category:Carbon compounds Category:Oxyanions Category:Carboxylate anions
title: Carboxylate
